input_output_options.title: Input/output options
input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

assembly.help_text: This is the assembly you wish to annotate.

outdir.description: The output directory where the results will be saved. You have to use absolute paths to storage on Cloud infrastructure.

email.help_text: Set this parameter to your e-mail address to get a summary e-mail with details of the run sent to you when the workflow exits. If set in your user config file (`~/.nextflow/config`) then you don't need to specify this on the command line for every run.

multiqc_title.description: MultiQC report title. Printed as page header, used for filename if not otherwise specified.

rnaseq_samples.description: Path to samplesheet for RNAseq data.
rnaseq_samples.help_text: If you wish to include RNAseq data, you will need to create a samplesheet in CSV format. Use this parameter to specify its location. It has to be a comma-separated file with 4 columns, and a header row.

proteins.description: Path to a fasta file with proteins
proteins.help_text: Specify a fasta-formatted file with proteins from related organisms. Typical sources are Uniprot, EnsEMBL or Refseq.

proteins_targeted.description: Path to a fasta file with proteins
proteins_targeted.help_text: Specify a fasta-formatted file with proteins your organism of interest. Typical sources are Uniprot, EnsEMBL or Refseq.

transcripts.description: Path to a fasta file with transcripts/ESTs
transcripts.help_text: Specify a fasta-formatted file with transcripts/ESTs from your organism of interest. Typical sources are ENA and dbEST.

rm_lib.description: Path to a fasta file with known repeat sequences for this organism
rm_lib.help_text: Specify a fasta-formatted file with repeat sequences for this organism. Typical sources are databases (NCBI, GRINST) or RepeatModeler.

references.description: Path to samplesheet for Reference genomes and annotations.
references.help_text: If you wish to If you wish to include annotations from related species (lift-over), you will need to create a samplesheet in CSV format.  Use this parameter to specify its location. It has to be a comma-separated file with 3 columns, and a header row.

npart_size.description: Chunk size for splitting the assembly.
npart_size.help_text: The assembly will split into pieces of this size, in bp, to increase parallelization.

max_intron_size.description: Maximum length of expected introns in bp.
max_intron_size.help_text: This option specifies the longest expected intron in base-pairs. Seeting this too low will result in broken gene models. Conversely, setting this too large may create unreasonable gene models and increase run time.

min_contig_size.description: Minimum size of contig to consider
min_contig_size.help_text: Small contigs will typically not add anything to the annotation, but can increase run time or trigger crashes. This value determines the cutoff for contig inclusion.

rm_species.description: Taxonomic group to guide repeat masking.
rm_species.help_text: Use this taxonomic group or species to identify and mask repeats. Valid names can, in most cases, be guessed, and follow the nomenclature provided through the [NCBI taxonomy](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy). This option draws from available data included in [DFam 3.2](https://www.dfam.org/releases/Dfam_3.2/relnotes.txt), which contains HMM profiles for over 273.0000 repeat families from 347 species.

rm_db.description: A database of curated repeats in EMBL format.
rm_db.help_text: This option points to the DFam database (h5 format) of curated repeats for RepeatMasker. By default, the pipeline will get it on-the-fly from the [DFam server](https://www.dfam.org/releases/Dfam_3.5/families/). You can pre-download the file (.gz) and provide it via this option.

busco_lineage.description: Name of a BUSCO taxonomic group to evaluate the completeness of annotated gene set(s).
busco_lineage.help_text: Use this to provide the name of a BUSCO [taxonomic group](https://busco.ezlab.org/list_of_lineages.html) against which to evaluate the resulting gene builds. Format should be taxgroup_odb10 (i.e. without the date).

busco_db_path.description: Path to the local BUSCO data.
busco_db_path.help_text: Use this to provide the path to a local copy of the busco database (usually /path/to/busco_downloads). For details, see the BUSCO [documentation](https://busco.ezlab.org/busco_userguide.html#download-and-automated-update).

eggnog_mapper_db.description: Path to a pre-installed EggnogMapper database.
eggnog_mapper_db.help_text: Path to local EggnogMapper database, including the desired taxon level. This triggers the functional annotation sub-workflow.

eggnog_taxonomy.help_text: Use this taxonomy ID to download an EggnogMapper database. A list of supported ID is available [here](http://eggnog5.embl.de/#/app/downloads). This triggers the functional annotation sub-workflow

dummy_gff.description: A placeholder gff file to help trigger certain processes.

augustus_options.title: Options for ab-initio gene finding
augustus_options.description: Options that control gene finding with AUGUSTUS

aug_species.help_text: Specify which model AUGUSTUS will run with. A full list is available [here](https://github.com/Gaius-Augustus/Augustus/blob/master/docs/RUNNING-AUGUSTUS.md).

aug_options.help_text: AUGUSTUS has many options that are not specifically available as pipeline options. Instead, you can pass them through this flag.

aug_config_dir.help_text: Use this to point to a AUGUSTUS config directory - for example if you have trained a new model outside of nf-core/genomeannotator. Must be compatible with AUGUSTUS 3.4. By default, the built-in version is used.

aug_extrinsic_cfg.description: Custom AUGUSTUS extrinsic config file path
aug_extrinsic_cfg.help_text: Provide a custom extrinsic config file to AUGUSTUS, specifying the weight of different types if evidence. We suggest you start with our [built-in](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nf-core/genomeannotator/dev/assets/augustus/augustus_default.cfg) base version.

aug_chunk_length.description: Length of annotation chunks in AUGUSTUS
aug_chunk_length.help_text: This value determines the length of a region worked on by each AUGUSTUS sub process. The overlap between neighboring chunks is 1/6 the chunk length. The default value should be adequate for most scenarios.

aug_training.description: Enable training of a new AUGUSTUS profile.
aug_training.help_text: This option enables training of a new AUGUSTUS prediction profile. You must provide either a full (!) species-specific proteome via --proteins_targeted or a sufficiently comprehensive set of transcripts/RNA-seq data. When both are provided, proteins will be preferred.

pri_prot.description: Priority for protein-derived hints for gene building.
pri_prot.help_text: This value determines the priority protein-derived hints are given during AUGUSTUS gene finding. The higher the value, the more important the hint (1-5).

pri_prot_target.help_text: A value to determine the weight of this type of evidence (1-5). A higher value means this type of evidence is given more consideration.

pri_est.help_text: A value to determine the weight of this type of evidence (1-5). A higher value means this type of evidence is given more consideration.

pri_rnaseq.description: Priority for RNAseq splice junction evidences
pri_rnaseq.help_text: A value to determine the weight of this type of evidence (1-5). A higher value means this type of evidence is given more consideration.

pri_wiggle.description: Priority for RNAseq exon coverage evidences
pri_wiggle.help_text: A value to determine the weight of this type of evidence (1-5). A higher value means this type of evidence is given more consideration.

pri_trans.description: Priority for trans-mapped gene model evidences
pri_trans.help_text: A value to determine the weight of this type of evidence (1-5). A higher value means this type of evidence is given more consideration.

t_est.help_text: A label for a given type of evidence - corresponds to labels in the AUGUSTUS extrinsic config file. Should not be changed.

t_prot.help_text: A label for a given type of evidence - corresponds to labels in the AUGUSTUS extrinsic config file. Should not be changed.

t_rnaseq.help_text: A label for a given type of evidence - corresponds to labels in the AUGUSTUS extrinsic config file. Should not be changed.

protein_tool_options.title: Options for protein data processing
protein_tool_options.description: Options that control processing of protein evidences

spaln_taxon.description: Taxon model to use for SPALN protein alignments.
spaln_taxon.help_text: This option specifies which SPALN alignment model to use. For a full list of available models, check [here](https://github.com/ogotoh/spaln/blob/master/table/gnm2tab).

spaln_options.help_text: USers can pass custom options to the SPALN alignment process. Normally, this will not be necessary!

spaln_protein_id.help_text: Users can pass custom id threshold to the SPALN alignment process. Normally, this will not be necessary!

min_prot_length.description: Minimum size of a protein sequence to be included.
min_prot_length.help_text: Protein-Databases often contain fragmented protein sequences. Use this option to filter out very small proteins from your evidence set.

nproteins.description: Numbe of proteins per alignment job.
nproteins.help_text: Specifies the number of proteins per alignnment job. This option controls parallelism - the higher this number, the fewer jobs are created and the longer the individual run times. Only increase if you have a very large number of proteins to process. The default value should be fine though.

spaln_q.description: Q value for the SPALN alignment algorithm.

spaln_protein_id_targeted.description: ID threshold for targeted protein alignments.

pasa_options.title: Options for PASA behavior
pasa_options.description: Options that control the PASA transcriptome annotation pipeline

pasa_nmodels.description: Number of PASA models to select for AUGUSTUS training.

pasa_aligner.description: Aligners to use in PASA pipeline.
pasa_aligner.help_text: Alignment tool(s) to be used by PASA (minimap2,gmap,blat). Multiple options are allowed, separated by comma.

evm_options.title: Options for EvidenceModeler behavior
evm_options.description: Options that control the EvidenceModeler pipeline

nevm.description: Number of EVM jobs per chunk.

annotation_tool_options.title: Options for tool behavior
annotation_tool_options.description: Options that control individual tool behavior

trinity.help_text: Assemble short-reads into transcripts using Trinity

pasa.help_text: Assemble into gene models using PASA.

evm.help_text: Perform consensus gene building using EvidenceModeler.

ncrna.description: Activate search for ncRNAs with RFam/infernal
ncrna.help_text: Perform prediction of non-coding RNAs using CM profiles from Rfam release 14.

institutional_config_options.title: Institutional config options
institutional_config_options.description: Parameters used to describe centralised config profiles. These should not be edited.
institutional_config_options.help_text: The centralised nf-core configuration profiles use a handful of pipeline parameters to describe themselves. This information is then printed to the Nextflow log when you run a pipeline. You should not need to change these values when you run a pipeline.

custom_config_version.description: Git commit id for Institutional configs.

custom_config_base.help_text: If you're running offline, Nextflow will not be able to fetch the institutional config files from the internet. If you don't need them, then this is not a problem. If you do need them, you should download the files from the repo and tell Nextflow where to find them with this parameter.

max_job_request_options.title: Max job request options
max_job_request_options.description: Set the top limit for requested resources for any single job.
max_job_request_options.help_text:
If you are running on a smaller system, a pipeline step requesting more resources than are available may cause the Nextflow to stop the run with an error. These options allow you to cap the maximum resources requested by any single job so that the pipeline will run on your system.

Note that you can not _increase_ the resources requested by any job using these options. For that you will need your own configuration file. See [the nf-core website](https://nf-co.re/usage/configuration) for details.

max_cpus.description: Maximum number of CPUs that can be requested for any single job.
max_cpus.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the CPU requirement for each process. Should be an integer e.g. `--max_cpus 1`

max_memory.description: Maximum amount of memory that can be requested for any single job.
max_memory.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the memory requirement for each process. Should be a string in the format integer-unit e.g. `--max_memory '8.GB'`

max_time.description: Maximum amount of time that can be requested for any single job.
max_time.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the time requirement for each process. Should be a string in the format integer-unit e.g. `--max_time '2.h'`

generic_options.title: Generic options
generic_options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.
generic_options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.

publish_dir_mode.description: Method used to save pipeline results to output directory.
publish_dir_mode.help_text: The Nextflow `publishDir` option specifies which intermediate files should be saved to the output directory. This option tells the pipeline what method should be used to move these files. See [Nextflow docs](https://www.nextflow.io/docs/latest/process.html#publishdir) for details.

email_on_fail.description: Email address for completion summary, only when pipeline fails.
email_on_fail.help_text: An email address to send a summary email to when the pipeline is completed - ONLY sent if the pipeline does not exit successfully.

plaintext_email.description: Send plain-text email instead of HTML.

max_multiqc_email_size.description: File size limit when attaching MultiQC reports to summary emails.

monochrome_logs.description: Do not use coloured log outputs.

multiqc_config.description: Custom config file to supply to MultiQC.

tracedir.description: Directory to keep pipeline Nextflow logs and reports.

validate_params.description: Boolean whether to validate parameters against the schema at runtime

show_hidden_params.help_text: By default, parameters set as _hidden_ in the schema are not shown on the command line when a user runs with `--help`. Specifying this option will tell the pipeline to show all parameters.

enable_conda.description: Run this workflow with Conda. You can also use '-profile conda' instead of providing this parameter.
